topic.title: Batch Processing WEB-based Shared Translation Memory Content

body.p: This processing supports the upload and download of masses of segments in one batch. E.g. uploading (importing) several thousands of segments contained in a *.TMX translation memory would be rather time-consuming using the standard memory import process.
body.section:
The Batch upload:
In case there is a large external translation memory (either *.EXP or *.TMX) that needs to be shared across team members, and that must be stored into a WEB-based Shared Translation Memory, follow these steps (import the external memory into by applying the standard translation memory import functionality):
Right mouse click into the Translation Memory list window.
From the context menu, select Import….
Within the dialog window Memory Import, navigate to the directory, where the external translation memory is located in, and select the translation memory you want to import. Click on the button Import.
In panel New Translation Memory, and from Type:, select Shared Translation Memory (Web based) (this is the important step that must take place to generate a WEB-based Shared Translation Memory).
The panel New Translation Memory.
The panel New Translation Memory.
Click the button Create. The panel Create a shared memory appears. See that all fields are already filled with data.
The panel Create a Shared Memory.
The panel Create a Shared Memory.
Click the button OK to finish the memory creation.
See the message panel that confirms that the translation memory was created successfully.
The message panel EQF0064.
The message panel EQF0064.
Click the button OK to finish the memory creation, and wait until the import process completed.
The message panel EQF0063.
The message panel EQF0063.
Click on button OK and the message window gets closed.
Begin the batch upload by right-mouse clicking on the newly imported translation memory.
From the context menu, select Batch upload.
Wait until the uploading has completed.
The context menu Batch upload.
The context menu Batch upload.
Important: In the panel Memory Replicator, and when uploading and downloading a translation memory in the batch-mode, make sure that the traslation memory is not contained in Selected.
The panel OpenTM2 Memory Replicator.
The panel OpenTM2 Memory Replicator.

section.p:
If there are large memories on the Web-based Shared Memory Server, and you want to download it to the local client, follow these steps:
Connect to the server as described in section 4.2 - Connecting to a Web-based Shared Translation Memory.
Panel Connect Shared Translation Memory databases opens.
In windows Available select the memory you want to download, and move it to the Selected window. Then click on the button Connect.
The panel Connect Shared Translation Memory databases
The panel Connect Shared Translation Memory databases
Right-mouse click the translation memory, and select “Batch download”.
Wait until the download has completed.
The context menu Batch download.
The context menu Batch download.
Important: In the panel Memory Replicator, and when uploading and downloading a translation memory in the batch-mode, make sure that the traslation memory is not contained in Selected.
